title: I just thought of a way that could be used to fix the friend request botting problem.
body:
Instead of barring low level players from sending friend requests, we should instead put up a system to prevent friend requests from being spammed.

The specific system would be that all players regardless of level would have a cap of friend requests that they can use, which will refill at a rate of one per day, or one per accept.

The idea of the system is to prevent bots from spamming literally everyone, to at least lower the number of requests streaming out. This system is not perfect, but it will help to prevent game botting by making it not affected by level, which means that the bots won't go into the games. And it should not affect the general player base, because players asking for friend invites generally ask people that they already know, and don't tend to ask more than a couple of people a day, unless they have been just added to a team, where there friend requests are almost sure to be accepted anyway.

Edit: Another issue that there is is that even if we had a way to report bots and get those accounts removed from the game even, all its takes is a few minutes for the person setting it up to make a new account with more bots, and this is not good, because it takes more and more username possibilities out of the mix.

Just whatever happens, Do not set a level minimum for friend requests, because low level games will just become bot games, with bots on both sides.

replies.body: Is there a way we can accept these friend request and automatically block/report them? With enough reports, the spam accounts should be auto-blocked until Riot can investigate.

There is only one problem with this, and this is the ease that botters could have in just making new bots. so they would just end up taking more user names, so on and so forth, but you make a good point in addressing this, because I did not originally.
You don't have to have someone on your friends list to play with them just manually enter your name. So for the 30 min you are level one they can just invite you.

This point really hasn't been touched on, mostly because the level 30 is generally excepted to not be a bot, so the friend request is perfectly alright from them. but a valid point none the less, if not entirely reasonable.
Thank you for reading, and post your thoughts in the comments please.
